arm_group.description: fentanyl based patient-controlled analgesia + additional opioid analgesics (pethidine)
continuous wound inflitration with ropivacaine + tramadol patient-controlled analgesia

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare immune responses (e.g. NK cell activity) of
      opioid-based analgesic regimen  versus non-opioid anlagesic regimen after laparoscopic
      colorectal surgery

clinical_study.brief_title: Opioid-based Analgesic Regimen Versus Non-opioid Analgesic Regimen for Better Immune Responses After Laparoscopic Colorectal Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ASA class I-III

          -  20-80 years old

          -  elective laparoscopic colorectal surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  drug allergy

          -  significant renal or hepatic impairment

          -  sign of infection

intervention.description: Opioid based analgesia : fentanyl based patient-controlled analgesia + additional opioid analgesics (pethidine) for postoperative 48 hour Non-opioid based analgesia : continuous wound inflitration with ropivacaine + tramadol patient-controlled analgesia for postoperative 48 hour
intervention.intervention_name: opioid based analgesia (fentanyl and pethidine) versus non-opioid based analgesia (ropivacaine and tramadol)

clinical_study.keyword: analgesia; colorectal surgery; immunity; local anesthetics; opioids

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine and Anesthesia and Pain Research Institute, Yonsei University College of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: NK cell activity : preoperation, just after operation, POD 1, POD 2

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine level : preoperation, just after operation, POD 1, POD 2

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
